result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Held by clerk with Atty Buckett and ADA Stumbris.  2-day Jury trial set 12/20/22 thru 12/21/22 and scheduling order completed. Final status hearing set for 12/13/22 at 1:30pm
Scheduling Order
Jury trial - 12 person on December 20, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Final status/scheduling conference on December 13, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

1:42 PM Prosecuting attorney Adam Yale Gerol in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Thomas Paul Debroux appeared by video, in custody of OZSD.  Attorney Robert Buckett in court for Thomas Paul Debroux Counsel's expert has completed his report and is prepared to schedule the jury trial date.  State does not have witness availability and requests a scheduling conference with the clerk. Court will set 2-day Jury Trial.  Telephonic scheduling conference set to confirm dates to use for trial (10/18 thru 10/20; 11/22 thru 11/23; 12/20 thru 12/22).
Telephone scheduling conference scheduled for August 1, 2022 at 08:15 am.
Telephone scheduling conference on August 1, 2022 at 08:15 am.

10:09 AM . Prosecuting attorney Benjamin Lindsay in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Thomas Paul Debroux appeared by video, in custody of OZSD.  Attorney Robert Buckett in court for Thomas Paul Debroux. Not guilty plea entered to amended information. Counsel requests another further proceedings to allow their expert to investigate.
Further proceedings scheduled for July 18, 2022 at 01:15 pm.
Further proceedings on July 18, 2022 at 01:15 pm.

10:24 AM Prosecuting attorney Adam Yale Gerol in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Thomas Paul Debroux appeared by video, in custody of OZSD.  Attorney Robert Buckett in court for Thomas Paul Debroux. Blood alcohol results are in but now awaiting results for chemical testing. Bail motion heard. State opposes. Court denies motion.
Further proceedings scheduled for June 20, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Further proceedings on June 20, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Forwarded as document for review to Branch 3 clerk .
Adjournment request granted by the court. 4/12/22 hearing reset to 4/28/22 at 10am.
Further proceedings on April 28, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Atty Buckett re: Adjournment Request.  Forwarded as document for review to Branch 3 clerk .
Filed by Atty Buckett

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Prosecutor

records.addlTxt: State's
Copy of information provided to counsel who waives reading and enters a not guilty plea.

Counsel waives reading of complaint and will waive preliminary hearing. Signed copy of waiver had not been received back from the jail yet but will be electronically filed upon receipt. Court examines defendant, accepts said waiver and binds matter over for trial. State informs.

1:39 PM Prosecuting attorney Benjamin Lindsay appeared in court for the State of Wisconsin, Defendant Thomas Paul Debroux appeared by video, in custody of OZSD. Atty Robert Buckett appears in person. Court has been advised by the public defender's office that the defendant does not qualify for their representation. Atty Buckett was contacted by the court and will accept a court appointment. Defendant will agree to the court appointment with repayment plan to be set at disposition of case.
Further proceedings scheduled for April 12, 2022 at 08:15 am.
Further proceedings on April 12, 2022 at 08:15 am.

10:31 AM . Prosecuting attorney Adam Yale Gerol appeared with student Maria Penkwitz in court for the State of Wisconsin, Defendant Thomas Paul Debroux appeared by video, in custody OZSD.  Defendant has not contacted public defender yet. Court finds good cause to extend time limits. Public defender present in court and will make contact with defendant.
Status conference scheduled for February 25, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
Status conference on February 25, 2022 at 01:00 pm.

Maintain absolute sobriety.  No possession/consumption of any intoxicants. Not to enter any bars or taverns or any business that sells intoxicants. No controlled substance or prescription medication unless prescribed by physician and in conformity with said prescription. Prescription must remain in original container. Not to operate a motor vehicle.  Submit to SCRAM within 2 hours on the day of bail posted. Otherwise release has to occur the following business day.

1:05 PM Prosecuting attorney Benjamin Lindsay appeared in court for the State of Wisconsin, Defendant Thomas Paul Debroux appeared by video, in custody of OZSD. Heather Dvoran appears stating defendant will represent himself. Court finds probable cause and advises of penalties. State requests cash bail with conditions. Court examines defendant regarding his waiver of right to an attorney. Defendant now wishes to contact the public defender's office to see if he qualifies. Time  limits waived.
Status hearing scheduled for February 21, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Status hearing on February 21, 2022 at 10:00 am.
